alert.note: Alert for Bay; Midland; Saginaw (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 5:31PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Michigan, including the following counties, Bay, Midland and Saginaw. * WHEN...Until 230 AM EDT Monday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 531 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to persistent and occasionally intense showers. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Saginaw, Midland, Bay City, Frankenmuth, Chesaning, Auburn, St. Charles, Birch Run, Pinconning, Coleman, Sanford, Freeland, Kawkawlin, Essexville, Edenville, Zilwaukee, Bentley, Merrill, Oakley and Linwood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
